summary: This bill, the Presidential Audit and Tax Transparency Act, mandates the IRS to conduct examinations of Presidential income tax returns and make reports publicly available. It also requires Presidents and major party Presidential candidates to disclose their tax returns for the past three years. The bill outlines the information to be included in these reports, the timing of disclosures, and addresses penalties for non-compliance. It amends existing laws regarding government ethics and tax information disclosure to facilitate these requirements.
